byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan indicates Turkey is prepared to undertake joint operation with United States to fight Islamic State in Raqqa, Syria; American officials do not comment on possible joint operation, which would represent major escalation for both countries in their involvement in Syria.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The move would be a major escalation in United States-Turkish intervention in Syria. Similar joint initiatives have been derailed by disagreements.
snippet: The move would be a major escalation in United States-Turkish intervention in Syria. Similar joint initiatives have been derailed by disagreements....

headline.main: Erdogan Says Turkey Would Join U.S. to Fight ISIS in Raqqa, an ISIS Bastion in Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Set to Carry Out Mission With U.S. Against ISIS Stronghold, Erdogan Says
